ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It has been a great course and I hope that I could had taken the year long one.
Independent study and writing. A lot of annoying deadlines.I would recommend doing a full year essay, you'll be expected to do all of your research in a month's time.

This class is the one semester senior essay for EP&E majors not writing their essays in a seminar. I enjoyed writing my essay in a non-seminar context, although I do wish I had done the year-long, which gives greater opportunity for intellectual research, and a less crammed writing schedule. I think the EPE Senior Essay Consultant (Tatiana) is fantastic - she kept me on track a lot of the time, and was a great sounding board for ideas I had. The key to having a positive experience in this essay is finding a topic you care about and an advisor who will mentor and guide you. I am glad to have had both.

You write a thesis. Make sure to start early and spread out the work. People who tackle the entire thing over a weekend are miserable; people who do it little by little actually end up enjoying the experience. At least that's my opinion on the matter.
If you want to do original research I would recommend doing the year long essay. But if can't find a data set to use - then go for the single semester. Its really all about how good your advisor is.
